III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
2

Allegation Youth was placed at facility from December 17, 2020, until
October 28, 2022. Almost everyday staff would hit youth with open
and closed fists, resulting in bruises.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed on March 5, 2024, and had no
further information to report.
Youth A was interviewed at the Delta County Children's
Assessment Center on March 13, 2024. Youth A stated she has
“memory loss” but will do her best to recount the concerns with
placement at Vassar House. Youth A said staff at Vassar would
“beat kids up during restraints” stating they would “lift kids head up
and slam them to the ground”. Youth A said she was restrained for
attempting to fight a peer and was brought outside by Staff 5, near
the front door, and Staff 5 shoved her finger on the outside of her
neck for a second which made her very scared. Youth A said Staff
1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Staff 4 were all present and watched this
occur however no youth were outside at the time. Youth A said
Staff 5 said to her “if you do not stop, I am going to kill you”. Youth
A said she did not tell anyone about this incident. Youth A said this
occurred two years ago in the Fall. Youth A said there were no
other times like this with Staff 5.
Youth A said Staff 3 placed her in a restraint and she resisted so
Staff 3 slammed her head back to the floor which gave her a sharp
and heavy pain that lasted a day. Youth A denied having any
bleeding or wound from this incident. Youth A said Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 4 all witnessed this event and did nothing to stop it.
Youth A said she would try to get out of the unit and Staff 2, Staff
3, and Staff 4 would slap, punch, and hit her. Youth A said she had
bruises on her legs, arms, back, and stomach from this. Youth A
said none of the staff would say anything, they would just hit her.
Youth A said this occurred multiple times and she never told
anyone about it. Youth A said these incidents took place on unit 2
and “all youth were present” however she was not able to
remember any youth’s names.
Youth A was interviewed via TEAMS on March 20, 2024, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement.
As the interview began, Youth A made the statement “I have
memory loss” but did not elaborate further on this. At times during
the interview Youth A was very scattered and would be difficult to
follow as she would change who she was talking about and who
was present when events occurred. Youth A said she was
previously placed at Vassar House and while there had her head
slammed during restraints. Youth A at first said Staff 1, Staff 2,
3

Staff 3, and Staff 4 all slammed her head during restraints
however she later said it occurred with Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth A
said Staff 2 restrained her once or twice, during the day, maybe in
“fall time”, on unit 2, in the middle of the floor, with all the youth
watching, however was unable to recall any of the youth’s names.
Youth A said she was trying to run out of the unit and was placed
in the restraint by Staff 2 and Staff 3. Youth A said during the
restraint Staff 2 told her “put your head down” and she picked it up
and Staff 2 used one of her hands on Youth A’s forehead and
slammed it back on the ground twice. Youth A said Staff 2 kept
pressure on her forehead for the remainder of the restraint. Youth
A said during the restraint she “fell asleep for about twenty
minutes”, stating she knew it was twenty minutes because she
asked the staff what time it was, fell asleep and when she awoke
the staff were still holding her and she asked what time it was
again, they told her the time, and it had been twenty minutes.
Youth A said she calmed down and was let go. Youth A said
another incident occurred in the back of unit 2, maybe in the Fall,
a couple days after Staff 2 slammed her head. Youth A said she
was in another restraint with Staff 3 for attempting to run out of the
unit. Youth A said Staff 1 assisted in this restraint. Youth A said
Youth B and Youth C were on the unit and witnessed the restraint.
Youth A at first said she was on her stomach during the restraint,
later stating she was on her back. Youth A said Staff 3 was holding
her arm with one arm and put her hand on Youth A’s forehead with
her other hand and slammed her head into the ground one time
stating, “you deserve it”. Youth A said she did not lose
consciousness and did not have any injuries, however stated she
had pain in the back of her head and had a headache. Youth A
said while placed at Vassar house she was also punched many
times by Staff 2 and Staff 3, but not daily. Youth A said she was on
unit 2, by the back door, no youth were present, Staff 3 was a
witness, when Staff 2 walked up to her and punched her in the
stomach twice with her right fist, stating “that is what you get for
being locked up in Vassar house”. Youth A said she responded to
Staff 2 saying “that is not nice” and Staff 2 made her go outside.
Youth A said Staff 3 saw Staff 2 punch Youth A and stated, “you
should punch her again”. Youth A said it was very painful, she had
a very large black and blue bruise in the middle of her stomach
from being punched. Youth A said no one saw the bruise. Youth A
denied seeing a nurse or medical treatment. Youth A said the
second time Staff 2 punched her she was on unit 2 with Staff 2
and Staff 3. Youth A said she was playing a game with Staff 3 and
had bumped into Staff 2 and they both fell to the ground. Youth A
said Staff 2 balled up her fist and punched her in the side three
times. Youth A said it hurt however she did not have any injury.
4

Youth A said this occurred in October. Youth A stated Staff 3 also
had punched her once on unit 2 with Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 4
present, however then stated that did not happen but rather Staff 3
pushed her to the ground and all four staff threatened to punch
her. Youth A said Staff 3 punched her while on unit 3, with Youth B,
Youth D or Youth E, and Youth F present, as well as Staff 1, Staff
2, and Staff 4. Youth A said she was sitting in the back corner of
the unit crying when Staff 3 walked up to her, grabbed her and
turned her around so she was facing the wall, and punched in her
in the back of the head with a closed fist. Youth A then changed
the sequence of events stating, Staff 3 had walked up to her and
tried to turn her around then pushed her and she fell down. Youth
A said she got back up and Staff 3 tried to restrain her and then
punched her in the back of the head. Youth A said Staff 1, Staff 2,
and Staff 4 watched this occur and did not stop the assault.
Youth A denied ever being slapped with an open hand by any staff
member. Youth A denied any other bruises from other staff. Youth
A denied ever being given medical attention for her head being
slammed or her bruises. Youth A said she never told anyone
because Staff 2 and Staff 3 said they would hurt her and put her in
the hospital if she told anyone.
Youth B was called via telephone on three different phone
numbers on April 2, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS
worker. Youth B is no longer in care and none of the phone
numbers where active, therefore no interview was completed.
Youth C was interviewed via TEAMS on April 2, 2024, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Youth C said she was
placed on the same unit as Youth A during her placement at
Vassar House. Youth C said she never saw Youth A restrained
throughout the duration of her placement. Youth C said she
remembers Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Staff 4. Youth C said she
had never seen Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, or Staff 4 slam Youth A’s
head on the ground or any other youth at the facility. Youth C said
she never saw Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, or Staff 4 physically assault
Youth A or any other youth at the facility. Youth C said she never
heard Youth A complain of any head injury or pain throughout the
duration of the placement.
Youth D was called via telephone on March 22, 2024, and
April 2, 2024. Youth D did not answer or return the phone calls
and therefore was not interviewed.
Youth E was called via telephone on March 22, 2024, and April
2, 2024. Youth E did not answer either phone call. Youth E did
5

respond to the MDHHS worker on April 11, 2024, and was
interviewed at that time. Youth E said she was in Vassar house
until November of 2022. Youth E said she remembers Youth A,
stating she was “white, blue eyes, mole on her face, and was a
little slow”. Youth E said she did not remember Staff 1 or Staff 3
however did remember Staff 2. Youth E denied ever seeing Staff 2
punch or hit Youth A or any other youth. Youth E stated, “nobody
mistreated [Youth A]”. Youth E said Youth A would attempt to run
off the unit and self-harm which would lead to her being
restrained. Youth E said she did not see Youth A getting restrained
but would “hear the commotion”. Youth E denied ever seeing
Youth A’s head being slammed to the ground. Youth E denied
seeing any staff punch or hit Youth A.
Youth F was called via telephone on March 22, 2024, and April
2, 2024. Youth F responded via text on April 2, 2024, however,
would not answer or return the phone call and therefore was not
interviewed.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 10,
2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 said she
worked at Vassar House for about five years, with November 2023
being the last month she worked. Staff 1 said she remembered
working with Youth A, stating she does not have any memory of
her being in restraints. Staff 1 denied ever seeing any staff hit,
punch, or slap Youth A. Staff 1 said she never saw any staff slam
Youth A’s head to the ground. Staff 1 said it was procedure for
when a youth was in a restraint and banging their head on the
ground to place a pillow under the youth’s head to prevent them
from harming themselves. Staff 1 denied seeing Staff 5 in any
restraints with Youth A or putting her finger up to or in Youth A’s
neck.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 10,
2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 2 said she
worked with Youth A at Vassar House. Staff 2 said she does not
recall Youth A being restrained, stating she does not have any
memory of any specific restraints with Youth A. Staff 2 denied ever
hitting Youth A with an open or closed hand, or seeing any other
staff hit Youth A with an open or closed hand. Staff 2 denied ever
punching Youth A in the stomach or seeing any other staff punch
Youth A in the stomach. Staff 2 denied ever slamming Youth A’s
head against the ground or seeing any other staff slam Youth A’s
head on the ground. Staff 2 said she has no knowledge of Youth A
ever going unconscious for any reason while at Vassar House.
6

Staff 2 said she does not remember Youth A ever complaining of
head pain or headaches.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 10,
2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 3 said she
worked as a Youth Care Worker in Vassar House with Youth A.
Staff 3 said Youth A was lower functioning, more aggressive, and
fluctuated between wanting to go home and not causing her
erratic behaviors. Staff 3 said she remembered one or two
restraints with Youth A, both with her being placed on the floor in
the supine position. Staff 3 said Youth A would struggle and try to
get up and staff would continue to hold her and talk to her. Staff 3
said Youth A would bang her head on the floor and staff would
place a pillow under her head to prevent injury. Staff 3 said she
never had to physically control Youth A’s head and never saw any
other staff holding Youth A’s head during the restraints. Staff 3
denied slamming Youth A’s head to the ground or seeing any other
staff slam Youth A’s head to the ground. Staff 3 said she never
saw Youth A go unconscious from a restraint or anything else
while placed at Vassar House. Staff 3 said she never heard Youth
A complain of head pain or frequent headaches. Staff 3 denied
ever hitting Youth A with an open or closed hand, or seeing any
other staff hit Youth A with an open or closed hand. Staff 3 said
she never saw Staff 5 participate in a restraint or place her hand
near Youth A’s neck.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on April 8, 2024, in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Staff 4 said she worked
at Vassar House from July of 2019 until December of 2021. Staff 4
recalled Youth A, but does not remember any specific restraints
with Youth A, however, does remember Youth A being a youth that
would bang her head during restraints. Staff 4 said the protocol
when a youth banged their head was to place a pillow under their
head. Staff 4 denied ever seeing any staff hit, slap, or punch Youth
A. Staff 4 said she never saw Staff 5 restrain or put her hand or
finger near Youth A’ neck. Staff 4 said she did not have any
concerns with Staff 1, Staff 2 or Staff 3’s interactions with the
youth at Vassar House.
Staff 5 was called via telephone on April 9, 2024, April 10,
2024, and April 25, 2024. Staff 5 is no longer a staff at Vassar
House. Staff 5 did not answer or return the phone calls and
therefore was not interviewed.
Documents Reviewed:
7

• Staff 1’s personnel file was reviewed: Staff 1 has
disciplinary action dated October 25, 2021, for failure to
properly supervise youth; on October 19, 2022, for failure to
report and failure to follow suicide protocol; and was
terminated on November 07, 2022, for failure to report and
failure to follow suicide protocol.
• Staff 2’s personnel file was reviewed: Staff 2 does not have
any disciplinary action in her file. Staff 2 is up to date on her
policy and procedure training.
• Staff 3’s personnel file was reviewed: Staff 3 has
disciplinary action dated November 21, 2022, for failure to
follow medication passing procedures. Staff 3 is up to date
on her policy and procedure training.
• Wolverine Human Services Policy for Prohibited
Interventions was reviewed. The staff are prohibited from
“use of physical discipline inflicted in any manner”.
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Support Management
Policy and Procedure was reviewed. The policy outlines the
expectation of staff when intervening with youth, when and
how to use physical interventions.
• Youth A’s incident reports from 1/1/2021 through
10/22/2022 were reviewed. Youth A had 67 incident reports,
none of which reported any staff injuring Youth A, and two
reports indicating Youth A self-harm her head. One by
banging her head on the wall and one with her pulling her
hair out of her head. There were no restraint incident
reports that indicated Youth A was injured during a restraint.
Analysis After interviews and review of documentation, it is determined the
facility is in compliance with Intervention standards and
prohibitions. Youth A was not consistent with her allegations. All
alleged staff, and youth witnesses denied witnessing assaults
occur.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
